meanings.definition: Leave hurriedly and secretly, typically to avoid detection or arrest.
meanings.sent1: The thief was absconding from the scene of the crime before the police arrived.
meanings.sent2: The spy was caught absconding with classified information.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was absconding with the toy mouse, playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The student was absconding from responsibility, hoping to escape the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent5: The shadowy figure was absconding into the night, disappearing without a trace.

meanings.sent1: The magician was absconding behind the curtain before the grand reveal.
meanings.sent2: The fugitive was skilled at absconding from the authorities and remaining unseen.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was absconding with nuts, storing them away for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The hermit was absconding from society, seeking solitude in the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The ninja was absconding into the darkness, blending in with the shadows.
